content: kokopelli blanket overlay mosaic crochet pattern us terms any yarn and any hook size can be used… i used #4 worsted weight with a 5mm hook the blanket measures 54 w x 70 h abbreviations this pattern uses us terminology single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet in uk terms double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet in uk terms bs border stitch mosaic crochet technique every row is worked with one color every stitch has one stitch worked into it so if you see 5dc 2sc you work one double_crochet into the next five stitches then one single_crochet into the next two stitches fasten and snip the yarn after each row always work on the front side only mosaic crochet does not require you to turn your work start the next row from the right-hand side on every row every double_crochet is worked into the front loop of the stitch two row below every single_crochet is worked into the back loop of the stitch one row below border stitches are always a single_crochet through both loops of the current row the first ten row of the blanket are written below continue from there using the charts this was a stashbuster for me i used primarily loops&threads impeccable and big twist value full list of the yarns used are at the end of the charts chart 1 row 1 - using color b in my sample pics b = heather chain 201 198 +2 bs + 1 turning chain single_crochet in the 2nd chain from the hook and in every chain 200 sts fasten_off and snip your yarn row 2 - using color a start from the right-hand side of your work and create your border stitch bs by working a single crochet single_crochet through both loops of the first stitch then continue single_crochet in the back loop of each stitch until you have one stitch left then create your last bs again working a single_crochet through both loops fasten_off row 3 -
